content: The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" includes sections on improving policies related to advance directives, Medicare coverage for end-of-life planning consultations, a national information hotline for end-of-life decision-making, and increasing awareness of end-of-life planning. The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" amends Medicare regulations to include the content of advance directives in medical records and provide individuals with the opportunity to discuss related issues with a professional. The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" amends Medicare regulations to include the content of advance directives in medical records and allows providers to honor out-of-state advance directives to the same extent as in-state directives, preempting any inconsistent state laws. The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" amends Medicaid regulations to include advance directives in medical records and provide individuals with the opportunity to have their directives honored. The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" amends Medicaid regulations to include advance directives in medical records and provide individuals with the opportunity to discuss issues with a trained professional. It also allows providers to honor advance directives executed outside the state to the same extent as those executed within the state, preempting any inconsistent state laws. The "Advance Directive Promotion Act of 2008" amends regulations to include advance directives in medical records and allows providers to honor directives executed outside the state to the same extent as those executed within the state. The amendments apply to provider agreements under title XVIII of the Social Security Act and State plans under title XIX, with an effective date specified by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, not later than 1 year after enactment. The State plan must meet additional requirements imposed by amendments without being considered non-compliant solely for not meeting them before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session. Medicare will cover end-of-life planning consultations as part of an initial preventive physical examination. Medicare covers end-of-life planning consultations, which involve discussions between a physician and an individual about preparing advance directives, situations where they may be needed, the benefits of a comprehensive end-of-life plan, and how to identify resources for understanding state requirements for treatment wishes. The amendments made by this section apply to initial preventive physical examinations furnished on or after January 1, 2009. SEC. 4. NATIONAL INFORMATION HOTLINE FOR END-OF-LIFE DECISIONMAKING AND HOSPICE CARE. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish a 24-hour toll-free hotline to provide information on advance directives, end-of-life decisionmaking, and hospice care services. SEC. 5. INCREASING AWARENESS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF END-OF-LIFE PLANNING. Title III of the Public Health Service Act will be amended to emphasize the importance of end-of-life planning. "PART S--PROGRAMS TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF ADVANCE DIRECTIVE PLANNING ISSUES. SEC. 399FF. ADVANCE DIRECTIVE EDUCATION CAMPAIGNS." The Secretary will conduct a national public education campaign to raise awareness about planning for end-of-life care, explain the importance of advance directives, and educate the public about hospice and palliative care. At least 60 percent of funds will be used for grants to public or nonprofit entities for this purpose. The Secretary will conduct a national public education campaign on end-of-life care, advance directives, hospice, and palliative care. Grants will be awarded for a 3-year period, with $25,000,000 authorized for appropriations.
